result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Martel Polk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to any sentence currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 10:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick Martel Polk appeared by video, in custody at Dodge Correctional Institution.  Attorney Kelly James Mattingly in court for Patrick Martel Polk. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads no contest to count 1. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders 1 year prison and 3 years extended supervision concurrent with any other sentence currently serving. Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program. Costs DOC collect. Sentence credit zero days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Activity: Status conference 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:30 PM Defendant Patrick Martel Polk in court by video in custody at Dodge Correctional with attorney Kelly James Mattingly by video.  David Zarwell appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on June 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Activity:  Adjourned initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:15 AM Defendant Patrick Martel Polk in court in custody by video with attorney Kelly James Mattingly by video.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on February 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.
